summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, forwarding a news summary about French ministers calling for an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities in France following his death. The email includes colleagues from the FBI and DOJ.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the news article; found dead while being held on sex-trafficking charges, prompting calls for investigation into his activities in France.

persons.name: Marline Schiappa
persons.context: French minister who called for an investigation into Epstein's activities in France in a public statement.

events.title: French Ministers Call for Investigation
events.description: Two French government ministers called for an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities in France.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in an apparent suicide while being held on sex-trafficking charges.

keyFacts: On August 12, 2019, French ministers called for an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities in France.
The call for investigation was prompted by Epstein's death in an apparent suicide while in custody on sex-trafficking charges.
French Gender Equality Minister Marline Schiappa stated the American investigation highlighted ties with France, necessitating a French inquiry.
The email was sent to colleagues from the FBI and DOJ, indicating inter-agency communication regarding the case.
The document shows international repercussions of Epstein's case, extending investigations beyond the United States.
